intro: Listera cordata subsp. nephrophylla, commonly known as the kidneyleaf basketflower, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short rhizomatous stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native habitats.
